list.name: Mr. Marklovitz
list.about: Mr. Marklovitz is a character who appears in the episode 'The Rickchurian Mortydate.' He is a wealthy businessman and friend of the President of the United States in the Rick and Morty universe. Mr. Marklovitz becomes involved in an interdimensional conflict, showcasing the influence of Rick's actions on both the government and business sectors.

list.name: Mr. Meeseeks
list.about: Mr. Meeseeks is a beloved character from the episode 'Meeseeks and Destroy' in Rick and Morty. These blue creatures are summoned by pressing a Meeseeks Box, and their purpose is to fulfill a single task before ceasing to exist. However, when tasks become too challenging or complicated, Mr. Meeseeks can experience mental and emotional turmoil.

list.name: Mr. Needful
list.about: Mr. Needful, also known as the Devil, is a character who appears in the episode 'Something Ricked This Way Comes.' He operates a mysterious antique shop called 'Needful Things' and offers cursed items to unsuspecting customers. Mr. Needful serves as a cautionary character, illustrating the consequences of making impulsive and selfish choices.

list.name: Mr. Poopybutthole
list.about: Mr. Poopybutthole is a fan-favorite character in Rick and Morty. He is introduced in the post-credits scene of the episode 'Total Rickall' and becomes a recurring character afterward. Despite his bizarre appearance, Mr. Poopybutthole is a friendly and supportive presence in the Smith family's lives, leading to numerous heartwarming and humorous moments.

list.name: Mrs. Lipkip
list.about: Mrs. Lipkip is a character who appears in the episode 'Anatomy Park.' She is Morty's math teacher at Harry Herpson High School. Mrs. Lipkip becomes an unwitting participant in Rick's adventure inside the human body, providing comedic moments as she navigates the bizarre and dangerous environment of Anatomy Park.

list.name: Mrs. Pancakes
list.about: Mrs. Pancakes is a character who appears in the episode 'M. Night Shaym-Aliens!' She is the wife of Mr. Pancakes and gets caught up in the simulation created by alien beings. Mrs. Pancakes adds to the absurdity of the episode as her character becomes entangled in Rick and Morty's attempts to escape the simulation.

list.name: Amy Poopybutthole
list.about: Amy Poopybutthole is not a known character from Rick and Morty. However, the show often introduces new characters, both major and minor, in each episode. So, there's always a possibility that Amy Poopybutthole might make an appearance in a future episode!

list.name: Mrs. Refrigerator
list.about: Mrs. Refrigerator is a character who appears in the episode 'Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind.' She is a sentient, anthropomorphic refrigerator who is a member of the Council of Ricks. Mrs. Refrigerator's unconventional nature showcases the limitless creativity and imagination of the show's creators.

list.name: Mrs. Sanchez
list.about: Mrs. Sanchez is a character who has not appeared in Rick and Morty. However, the show often explores the family dynamics of the Smiths, including Rick's daughter Beth, Morty's mother. Given the unpredictable nature of the series, there's always a chance that Mrs. Sanchez could be introduced in a future episode!

list.name: Mrs. Sullivan
list.about: Mrs. Sullivan is a character who has not appeared in Rick and Morty. As the show is known for its ever-expanding cast of characters, it's always possible for new individuals to be introduced. Perhaps Mrs. Sullivan could make her debut in an upcoming episode, adding to the eclectic ensemble of the series!

list.name: Nancy
list.about: Nancy is a character from the animated series Rick and Morty. She is the ex-wife of Jerry Smith and the mother of their children, Summer and Morty. A curious fact about Nancy is that she is shown to have a somewhat rebellious and adventurous side, as seen in the episode 'Rickmancing the Stone.' In this episode, Nancy joins a post-apocalyptic gang called the Death Stalkers and embraces a more chaotic and unpredictable lifestyle. This unexpected twist in her character adds depth and complexity to her role in the show, showcasing the writers' ability to surprise and subvert expectations.

list.name: Noob-Noob
list.about: Noob-Noob is a minor character in the animated series Rick and Morty. He is a janitor at the Vindicators headquarters and often gets overlooked and underappreciated by the other characters. However, Noob-Noob has a surprising talent for improvisational comedy. In the episode 'Vindicators 3: The Return of Worldender,' Noob-Noob delivers an impromptu stand-up routine to entertain the remaining members of the Vindicators team. His unexpected comedic skills not only provide a lighthearted moment in the midst of a tense situation but also highlight the show's knack for creating memorable characters with hidden talents.

list.name: Numbericon
list.about: Numbericon is a character from the animated series Rick and Morty. He is a robotic entity with a human-like appearance and the ability to manipulate numbers and calculations. A curious fact about Numbericon is that his design and abilities are a parody of the Marvel Comics character, The Vision. Numbericon's red and green color scheme, along with his analytical nature, are direct references to The Vision, who is known for his similar attributes. This clever homage showcases the show's penchant for referencing and incorporating elements from various pop culture sources, adding an extra layer of enjoyment for fans familiar with these references.

list.name: Octopus Man
list.about: Octopus Man is a character from the animated series Rick and Morty. He is a humanoid creature with the upper body of an octopus. A curious fact about Octopus Man is that he is voiced by Tom Kenny, who is also known for providing the voice of SpongeBob SquarePants. Tom Kenny's distinctive voice acting brings Octopus Man to life, infusing the character with a unique blend of charm and humor. This casting choice adds an extra layer of delight for viewers who are fans of Tom Kenny's iconic portrayal of SpongeBob, further highlighting the show's attention to detail and ability to create memorable characters.

list.name: Orthodox Jew
list.about: Orthodox Jew is a character from the animated series Rick and Morty. He is a member of an alien species known as the Gear People. A curious fact about Orthodox Jew is that his design and name are a playful nod to the cultural and religious practices of Orthodox Jews in the real world. Despite the humorous portrayal, the character serves as a reminder of the show's ability to incorporate diverse cultural references and satirical commentary. This inclusion highlights the show's knack for blending comedy with social commentary, creating a thought-provoking and engaging viewing experience.

list.name: Pat Gueterman
list.about: Pat Gueterman is a character from the animated series Rick and Morty. He is a news anchor and reporter who often covers events in the show's universe. A curious fact about Pat Gueterman is that his character is voiced by the show's co-creator, Justin Roiland. Justin Roiland's distinctive voice can be heard throughout the series, as he lends his vocal talents to several characters. By voicing Pat Gueterman, Roiland adds an extra layer of humor and familiarity for fans who recognize his voice from other prominent characters such as Rick Sanchez and Morty Smith.

list.name: Paul Fleishman
list.about: Paul Fleishman is a character from the animated series Rick and Morty. He is a news anchor and reporter who often appears in the show's news segments. A curious fact about Paul Fleishman is that his character is a reference to real-life journalist and news anchor, Wolf Blitzer. The name and appearance of Paul Fleishman are direct parodies of Wolf Blitzer, known for his work on CNN. This playful homage to a prominent figure in the news industry adds an extra layer of humor and satirical commentary to the show's portrayal of media and journalism.

list.name: Pawnshop Clerk
list.about: The Pawnshop Clerk is a minor character in the animated series Rick and Morty. He is an employee at a pawnshop and often interacts with Rick and Morty during their adventures. A curious fact about the Pawnshop Clerk is that he is voiced by Jess Harnell, a prolific voice actor known for his work in various animated series and films. Harnell's versatile vocal range and comedic timing bring the character to life, adding an extra layer of entertainment to the show's already vibrant and diverse cast of characters.

list.name: Pencilvester
list.about: Pencilvester is a character from the animated series Rick and Morty. He is an alternate reality version of Rick Sanchez who exists as a sentient pencil. A curious fact about Pencilvester is that his design and concept are a playful parody of the show's own protagonist, Rick Sanchez. By transforming Rick into a pencil, the writers cleverly satirize the character's intellect and resourcefulness, highlighting the absurdity and creativity that are hallmarks of the show. Pencilvester's inclusion serves as a testament to the series' willingness to push boundaries and explore unconventional ideas.

list.name: Phillip Jacobs
list.about: Phillip Jacobs is a character from the animated series Rick and Morty. He is a student at Harry Herpson High School and is often seen in the background of various school-related scenes. A curious fact about Phillip Jacobs is that he is named after Phil Jacobs, one of the show's storyboard artists. This naming choice is a playful nod to the behind-the-scenes contributors who help bring the show to life. It showcases the show's appreciation for its creative team and adds an extra layer of insider humor for fans who are familiar with the individuals involved in the production process.
